bibl.title: Vision and Visibility: Art Historical Theory Paints a Portrait of New Leadership in Posidippus' Andriantopoiika.
bibl.note: P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309, coll. x, 8-xi, 19 = 62-70 Austin-Bastianini.

bibl.title: Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309)

bibl.seg: KOSMETATOU Elizabeth, Vision and Visibility: Art Historical Theory Paints a Portrait of New Leadership in Posidippus' Andriantopoiika.

Benjamin ACOSTA-HUGHES, Elizabeth KOSMETATOU and Manuel BAUMBACH (Edd.), Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309) = Hellenic Studies. 2 (Washington, D.C. - Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2004) pp. 187-211.
P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309, coll. x, 8-xi, 19 = 62-70 Austin-Bastianini.
